articles.headline: From Starbucks to FedEx, Coronavirus Upends Businesses That Depend on China
articles.snippet: The virus outbreak has rattled the global economy, disrupting supply chains and closing off access to a lucrative consumer market.
articles.abstract: The virus outbreak has rattled the global economy, disrupting supply chains and closing off access to a lucrative consumer market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus outbreak in China has rattled the global economy, disrupting virtually every major industry, from food, fashion and entertainment to automobiles and technology.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany

articles.headline: Trump Fires Impeachment Witnesses Gordon Sondland and Alexander Vindman in Post-Acquittal Purge
articles.snippet: Emboldened by his victory and determined to strike back, the president removed Mr. Sondland as ambassador to the European Union after the White House earlier on Friday dismissed Colonel Vindman.
articles.abstract: Emboldened by his victory and determined to strike back, the president removed Mr. Sondland as ambassador to the European Union after the White House earlier on Friday dismissed Colonel Vindman.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump wasted little time on Friday opening a campaign of retribution against those he blames for his impeachment, firing two of the most prominent witnesses in the House inquiry against him barely 48 hours after being acquitted by the Senate.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Maggie Haberman, Danny Hakim and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: How Pete Buttigieg Became the Surprise of the Iowa Caucuses
articles.snippet: Joe Biden’s organization remained weak. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren focused on cities and college towns. Mr. Buttigieg, however, went everywhere.
articles.abstract: Joe Biden’s organization remained weak. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren focused on cities and college towns. Mr. Buttigieg, however, went everywhere.
articles.lead_paragraph: OELWEIN, Iowa — Two days before the Iowa caucuses, Pete Buttigieg stopped for a town hall event at the Oelwein Coliseum, a 92-year-old music venue that in its heyday hosted the likes of Lawrence Welk and Sammy Kaye.
articles.byline: By Reid J. Epstein and Trip Gabriel

articles.headline: Maybe Information Actually Doesn’t Want to Be Free
articles.snippet: Jessica Lessin’s online tech publication costs $399 a year and has no ads. Silicon Valley’s elite is eating it up.
articles.abstract: Jessica Lessin’s online tech publication costs $399 a year and has no ads. Silicon Valley’s elite is eating it up.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Jessica Lessin thinks the biggest story of the moment — how tech is swallowing the universe — is hopelessly under-covered by the news media. The issue is “massive,” she said not long ago in her spare, cube-like office here, and “no one is paying attention.”
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee

articles.headline: A New Martyr Puts a Face on China’s Deepening Coronavirus Crisis
articles.snippet: The death of the doctor whose warnings about the coronavirus were silenced has become a potent symbol of Beijing’s failures.
articles.abstract: The death of the doctor whose warnings about the coronavirus were silenced has become a potent symbol of Beijing’s failures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WUHAN, China — More than 700 people have died. Tens of thousands are infected. Millions are living under lockdown, and the government has sought to silence complaints.
articles.byline: By Chris Buckley and Paul Mozur

articles.headline: Victors in Iowa, Sanders and Buttigieg Are Targets in Democratic Debate
articles.snippet: In the most contentious debate so far, Joseph R. Biden Jr. challenged Bernie Sanders over gun regulation, and Amy Klobuchar accused Pete Buttigieg of presenting himself as a “cool newcomer.”
articles.abstract: In the most contentious debate so far, Joseph R. Biden Jr. challenged Bernie Sanders over gun regulation, and Amy Klobuchar accused Pete Buttigieg of presenting himself as a “cool newcomer.”
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — The two victors in the Iowa caucuses, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and former Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., came under sharp and sustained criticism in a Democratic presidential debate on Friday, as their rivals tried to stop their momentum by assailing Mr. Sanders for his left-wing ideas and past opposition to gun control while targeting Mr. Buttigieg over his thin résumé and ties to big donors.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: ‘Helicopter Went Down, Flames Seen’: Kobe Bryant’s Last Flight
articles.snippet: Eight passengers and a pilot were on the S-76B helicopter that crashed on a foggy hillside in the Santa Monica Mountains. This is the story of what happened.
articles.abstract: Eight passengers and a pilot were on the S-76B helicopter that crashed on a foggy hillside in the Santa Monica Mountains. This is the story of what happened.
articles.byline: By John Branch, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Sarah Mervosh and Miriam Jordan

articles.headline: Where’s Xi? China’s Leader Commands Coronavirus Fight From Safe Heights
articles.snippet: Xi Jinping has backed out of the spotlight as the country faces its worst crisis in years, reflecting the political risks he faces if efforts to contain the virus fail.
articles.abstract: Xi Jinping has backed out of the spotlight as the country faces its worst crisis in years, reflecting the political risks he faces if efforts to contain the virus fail.
articles.lead_paragraph: WUHAN, China — President Xi Jinping strode onstage before an adoring audience in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing less than three weeks ago, trumpeting his successes in steering China through a tumultuous year and promising “landmark” progress in 2020.
articles.byline: By Chris Buckley and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: On Trump’s To-Do List: Take Back The Suburbs. Court Black Voters. Expand the Electoral Map. Win.
articles.snippet: With impeachment behind the president, his re-election campaign wants to address political weaknesses exacerbated by his policies and behavior.
articles.abstract: With impeachment behind the president, his re-election campaign wants to address political weaknesses exacerbated by his policies and behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Read our 2020 presidential election electoral college explainer.]
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Annie Karni and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Wobbly After Iowa, Biden Confronts a Perilous Moment
articles.snippet: A weak showing in New Hampshire, some Democrats warn, could undermine his electability argument and accelerate a flight of donors and voters to his rivals.
articles.abstract: A weak showing in New Hampshire, some Democrats warn, could undermine his electability argument and accelerate a flight of donors and voters to his rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s fourth-place finish in Iowa and his wobbly standing here in New Hampshire are now testing the central premise of his candidacy — that he is the Democrat with the strongest chance to defeat President Trump — and forcing his team to scramble to prove that claim before voters move on to other candidates.
articles.byline: By Katie Glueck and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: For Thousands of Years, Egypt Controlled the Nile. A New Dam Threatens That.
articles.snippet: Ethiopia is staking its hopes on its $4.5 billion hydroelectric dam. Egypt fears it will cut into its water supplies. President Trump is mediating.
articles.abstract: Ethiopia is staking its hopes on its $4.5 billion hydroelectric dam. Egypt fears it will cut into its water supplies. President Trump is mediating.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ethiopia is staking its hopes on its $4.5 billion hydroelectric dam. Egypt fears it will cut into its water supplies. President Trump is mediating.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh, Somini Sengupta and Laura Boushnak

articles.headline: What Happens When QAnon Seeps From the Web to the Offline World
articles.snippet: It began online as an intricate, if baseless, pro-Trump conspiracy theory. Now it has surfaced in political campaigns, criminal cases and a college classroom.
articles.abstract: It began online as an intricate, if baseless, pro-Trump conspiracy theory. Now it has surfaced in political campaigns, criminal cases and a college classroom.
articles.lead_paragraph: A city council member in California took the dais and quoted from QAnon, a pro-Trump conspiracy theory about “deep state” traitors plotting against the president, concluding her remarks, “God bless Q.”
articles.byline: By Mike McIntire and Kevin Roose

articles.headline: Her Grandmother Got the Coronavirus. Then So Did the Whole Family.
articles.snippet: “What kind of government is this?’ asks a family of three generations sickened by the new virus and desperate for care in Wuhan, the Chinese city at the center of the outbreak.
articles.abstract: “What kind of government is this?’ asks a family of three generations sickened by the new virus and desperate for care in Wuhan, the Chinese city at the center of the outbreak.
articles.lead_paragraph: WUHAN, China — Bella Zhang hung an intravenous drip on a spindly tree branch and slumped down on a large stone planter outside the crowded hospital. Her mother and brother sat wearily beside her, their shoulders sagging, both also hooked up to their own drips.
articles.byline: By Amy Qin

articles.headline: ‘Do Not Make Any Loud Noises’: A Thai Soldier’s 18-Hour Shooting Rampage
articles.snippet: The authorities said the mass shooting, a rarity in the country, started over a real estate dispute and ended with at least 29 people dead and 58 injured.
articles.abstract: The authorities said the mass shooting, a rarity in the country, started over a real estate dispute and ended with at least 29 people dead and 58 injured.
articles.lead_paragraph: KORAT, Thailand — The authorities killed the gunman near the cold storage refrigerators of the Foodland supermarket in the mall he terrorized during Thailand’s deadliest mass shooting.
articles.byline: By Muktita Suhartono and Damien Cave

articles.headline: He Combs the Web for Russian Bots. That Makes Him a Target.
articles.snippet: Ben Nimmo helped pioneer disinformation investigations. His work is now more urgent as misleading internet tactics spread.
articles.abstract: Ben Nimmo helped pioneer disinformation investigations. His work is now more urgent as misleading internet tactics spread.
articles.lead_paragraph: HADDINGTON, Scotland — In August 2017, Ben Nimmo was declared dead by 13,000 Russian bots on Twitter.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano

articles.headline: ‘Losing Friends’ Over How She Covers the New Hampshire Primary
articles.snippet: The podcaster Lauren Chooljian has irked some people in the state with “Stranglehold,” a close look at an all-important contest.
articles.abstract: The podcaster Lauren Chooljian has irked some people in the state with “Stranglehold,” a close look at an all-important contest.
articles.lead_paragraph: CONCORD, N.H. — The other day, Lauren Chooljian received a text from her father, a lifelong New Hampshire resident, that said: “You’re losing friends in nh.”
articles.byline: By Marc Tracy

articles.headline: Ransomware Attacks Grow, Crippling Cities and Businesses
articles.snippet: Hackers are locking people out of their networks and demanding big payments to get back in. New data shows just how common and damaging the attacks have become.
articles.abstract: Hackers are locking people out of their networks and demanding big payments to get back in. New data shows just how common and damaging the attacks have become.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — New Orleans’s city government crippled. A maritime cargo facility temporarily closed. Hospitals forced to turn away patients. Small businesses shuttered.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper

articles.headline: How the Iowa Caucuses Became an Epic Fiasco for Democrats
articles.snippet: The problems that beset the Democratic Party’s first state caucus of the presidential race ran far deeper and wider than one bad app.
articles.abstract: The problems that beset the Democratic Party’s first state caucus of the presidential race ran far deeper and wider than one bad app.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — The first signs of trouble came early.
articles.byline: By Reid J. Epstein, Sydney Ember, Trip Gabriel and Mike Baker

articles.headline: Sanders and Buttigieg Clash, Aiming for a Two-Person Race
articles.snippet: The point of the attacks was not to set off mass defections between the left and the center, but rather to consolidate support on one side of the party or the other.
articles.abstract: The point of the attacks was not to set off mass defections between the left and the center, but rather to consolidate support on one side of the party or the other.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOOKSETT, N.H. — Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and former Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Ind., clashed throughout the day on Sunday, in a combative display of their determination to treat the upcoming New Hampshire primary as a two-person race, with former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. continuing to struggle.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: What Needs to Happen to Get Boeing’s 737 Max Flying Again?
articles.snippet: The plane could be back in the air relatively soon, but the company, regulators and airlines must do several things first.
articles.abstract: The plane could be back in the air relatively soon, but the company, regulators and airlines must do several things first.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boeing’s 737 Max could be flying again before too long.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Natalie Kitroeff

articles.headline: Trump’s Budget Math Grapples With Economic Reality
articles.snippet: The budget predicts the economy will grow significantly faster than most economists anticipate.
articles.abstract: The budget predicts the economy will grow significantly faster than most economists anticipate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s budget proposals have been defined by a belief that the economy will grow significantly faster than most economists anticipate. The latest version, released on Monday, is a brief departure: It concedes, for the first time, that the administration’s past projections were too optimistic.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Cruise Ship’s Coronavirus Outbreak Leaves Crew Nowhere to Hide
articles.snippet: Cases of the new virus on the quarantined Diamond Princess reached 135 Monday, including 20 Americans. Conditions below decks could risk further spread.
articles.abstract: Cases of the new virus on the quarantined Diamond Princess reached 135 Monday, including 20 Americans. Conditions below decks could risk further spread.
articles.lead_paragraph: YOKOHAMA, Japan — In the passenger decks of the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship, more than 2,500 travelers are carefully isolated. Meals are delivered to their cabins. They have permission to walk on deck, six feet apart, for a few minutes a day.
articles.byline: By Ben Dooley and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: Your Foam Coffee Cup Is Fighting for Its Life
articles.snippet: The Dart Container Corporation, which makes foam products, is a manufacturing behemoth and produced a fortune for the family behind it. Environmentalists say its products are polluting the globe.
articles.abstract: The Dart Container Corporation, which makes foam products, is a manufacturing behemoth and produced a fortune for the family behind it. Environmentalists say its products are polluting the globe.
articles.lead_paragraph: MASON, Mich. — The Dart Container Corporation, by some measures, is an American success story.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery

articles.headline: U.S. Charges Chinese Military Officers in 2017 Equifax Hacking
articles.snippet: The indictment suggests that the breach was part of a series of thefts by China to use the data to target American officials.
articles.abstract: The indictment suggests that the breach was part of a series of thefts by China to use the data to target American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Four members of China’s military were charged on Monday with hacking into Equifax, one of the nation’s largest credit reporting agencies, and stealing trade secrets and the personal data of about 145 million Americans in 2017.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner
